sysmsg.h File Reference

Include file for system messages. More...

#include "sysmsg.c"

Data Structures

struct  SYSMSG
 Definition of a system message object. More...

Defines

#define SYSMSG_ACTIVE
 This define can be evaluated to check if this module is included and active.
Configuration Data
The values of these parameters can be overwritten by defining them before including this file.

#define SYSMSG_vUpdateTimer_TOUT   80
 Display time for a message (= display time in s *16).
#define SYSMSG_vBufferSize   10
 Default size (lines) of message buffer.
#define SYSMSG_vLayer   20
 Default layer of message buffer text object.
#define SYSMSG_strFont   "ackfont.pcx"
 Default font of message buffer.
Constant Data - Message Visibility
These defines are used to define which message types will be shown by the system message object.

Allowing multiple message types can be achieved by bitwise or-ing the defines (just treat them like the usual A7 object flags). For setting use SYSMSG_setMode. By default all types of messages are shown . It is possible and also makes sense to define your own types if needed in order to keep things understandable

#define SYSMSG_SHOW_NONE   0
#define SYSMSG_SHOW_DEBUG   1
#define SYSMSG_SHOW_ERROR   2
#define SYSMSG_SHOW_DEFAULT   4
#define SYSMSG_SHOW_SYSTEM   8
#define SYSMSG_SHOW_PLUGIN   16
Constant Data - Message Types
These defines are used to specify message type for SYSMSG_print.

It is possible and also makes sense to define your own types if needed in order to keep things understandable

#define SYSMSG_DEBUG   1
#define SYSMSG_ERROR   2
#define SYSMSG_DEFAULT   4
#define SYSMSG_SYSTEM   8
#define SYSMSG_PLUGIN   16

Detailed Description

Include file for system messages.

Function Documentation

void SYSMSG_create ( char *  pcFont,
var  vBufferSize,
var  vLayer 
)

creates new System message object.

Parameters:
pcFont font filename
vBufferSize size of buffer
vLayer layer of TEXT object

void SYSMSG_create (  ) 

creates new System message object.

default values are used: font ackfont.pcx, buffer size 10, layer 20

void SYSMSG_hide (  ) 

Hide system messages.

System message object is only hidden from screen, but is NOT deleted or released from memory!

var SYSMSG_isActive (  ) 

Get current status of sysmsg.

Returns:
0: sysmsg inactive 1: sysmsg active

void SYSMSG_logToFile ( int  iEnable  ) 

Enable/disbale logging of system messages.

Messages are logged to sysmsg.log

Parameters:
iEnable 0(default) - don't log, any other value - perform log

void SYSMSG_print ( int  iMode,
STRING *  strMsg 
)

Print system message to screen.

Parameters:
iMode Allowed message mode (SYSMSG_SHOW_xx)
strMsg text message

char *  pcMsg

Print system message to screen.

Parameters:
iMode Allowed message mode (SYSMSG_SHOW_xx)
pcMsg text message

void SYSMSG_print ( STRING *  strMsg  ) 

Print system message to screen.

(DEFAULT type)

Parameters:
strMsg text message

void SYSMSG_print ( char *  pcMsg  ) 

Print system message to screen.

(DEFAULT type)

Parameters:
pcMsg text message

void SYSMSG_remove (  ) 

Removes System message object from memory.

All referenced objects will be removed as well.

void SYSMSG_setFlags ( var  vFlags  ) 

Set flags for text window.

Flags can be taken from description of standard TEXT object.

Parameters:
vFlags Bitwise-ored A7 TEXT flags

void SYSMSG_setMode ( int  iMode  ) 

Set message modes to be displayed.

Define, which message types (SYSMSG_SHOW_...) are shown

Parameters:
iMode Allowed message modes, bitwise-or of SYSMSG_SHOW_xx

void SYSMSG_setPos ( var  vX,
var  vY 
)

Set position of text window.

Parameters:
vX x Position on screen
vY y Position on screen

void SYSMSG_setScale ( var  vX,
var  vY 
)

Set scaling of text window.

Parameters:
vX x Scale value
vY y Scale value

void SYSMSG_show (  ) 

Show system messages.

Appearance of system message object may be changed before by setting TEXT properties.
